Merge pull request #2640 from guardian/aa-img-pointer-events

prevent image download with right click

prevent image download with right click

By adding `pointer-events: none` to the img element, the browser pushes pointer events to the element below the img. That is, when you right click on the image, you're no longer able to download it.

As a result, we need to push the drag-data to a parent element so that you can still drag the image into Composer, InDesign etc.

Merge pull request #2615 from guardian/akash1810-patch-1

Use GitHub Actions for CI
no need to bind to host

Add GitHub Action to build on push.

This is so external contributions can be built in a transparent way (our CI service is IP locked). This does everything TeamCity does except upload a deployable to RiffRaff.

There are two Jobs that run in parallel:
- CI for JavaScript apps (Kahuna, S3Watcher, Reaper)
- CI for scala apps

Notes:
- Launches elasticsearch outside the integration tests (making use of #2571)
- Defines custom Dockerfile for scala build with imaging libraries needed for tests and SBT

Merge pull request #2627 from guardian/aa-fail-fast

Fail fast when image not found.

Fail fast when image not found.

Previously, we were always trying to parse the response from elasticsearch into an Image and logging at error level when it failed.

This meant that 404s produce noisy logs relating to json parsing failure which isn't helpful.

Now, we only try to parse the response to an Image if the request succedded (that is, we recieved a hit from elasticsearch).
Merge pull request #2624 from guardian/dependabot/npm_and_yarn/kahuna/mixin-deep-1.3.2

update date parsing

`.getParser` does not appear to obey the timezone, that is BST was getting parsed into the local timezone. This is incorrect, so add a timezone offset for BST (we're assuming British Summer Time); this means we have to attempt parsing ourselves.

Also stores dates as ISODateTimeFormat because its easier to reason about.

store read dates as ISODateTimeFormat

It is easier to understand! It is also more accurate as BST can mean:
- British Summer Time
- Bangladesh Standard Time
- Bougainville Standard Time

See https://24timezones.com/time-zone/bst.

Bump mixin-deep from 1.3.1 to 1.3.2 in /kahuna

Bumps [mixin-deep](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/mixin-deep) from 1.3.1 to 1.3.2.
- [Release notes](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/mixin-deep/releases)
- [Commits](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/mixin-deep/compare/1.3.1...1.3.2)

Signed-off-by: dependabot[bot] <support@github.com>

Merge pull request #2607 from guardian/aa-under-quota

invert over-quota to under-quota

invert over-quota to under-quota

It is more common to ask "what images can I use (under-quota)" rather than "what images can I not use (over-quota)".

Whilst the former could be expressed as not(over-quota), it is by far the more common query so should be the default; to get over-quota we now do not(under-quota).

Merge pull request #2573 from guardian/mbarton/batch

Disallow edits in the UI whilst batch operations in progress

Disallow edits in the UI whilst batch operations in progress

We were forgetting to return the result to `Promise.all` so as far as the UI was concerned the operation completed almost immediately and you could edit again. Now we return the Promise for each edit, meaning the UI holds the edit UI open until all the edits complete (or the first failure)

Merge pull request #2570 from guardian/akash1810-patch-1

bump prout threshold

bump prout threshold

12 minutes was a slightly arbitrary number taken from another prout config. As it turns out, it's slightly too short for Grid; this is perhaps the result of a long CI queue or it taking too long for the new instances in a deploy to report healthy. In any case, increasing the time to 30 minutes will have the effect of being more tolerant and less chatty whilst still remaining useful.

remove heartbeat messages
remove `sqs.message.min.frequency` from config generation
remove healthcheck from Thral SQS message consumer

remove heartbeat messages from Kinesis

Heartbeat messages are (were) used to help determine the healthcheck of Thrall. Thrall's healthcheck required Thrall to have processed at least one message in the last `sqs.message.min.frequency` minutes.

We're not sending these messages to Kinesis, so this is actually just non-executed code.

Merge pull request #2508 from guardian/aa-persisted-filter

use nested query for Usages
DRY out code

use nested query for Usages

Usages is a nested field in ES6, therefore we need to use a nested query against that field - https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/guide/current/nested-query.html.

This PR fixes the persisted filter (including tests). `has:usages` is not fixed, however; we can do this as a separate PR.

Merge pull request #2464 from guardian/aa-ðŸ¤£ðŸ¤£ðŸ¤£ðŸ¤£ðŸ¤£

fix odd date issue

fix odd date issue

When performing ES date aggregations, we're using the month as the interval.

Our test images would sometimes span two months and sometimes one month, this is because we were doing:
- Image A uploaded today
- Image B uploaded 25 days ago

Between 26th and 31st of every month, this test would fail because the number of monthly buckets would be one. However from 1st to 25th of every month, there would be two monthly buckets and the tests would pass.

Image B was a fairly recent addition, hence we've never seen this behaviour until now.
DRY out code

allow cropType to be cleared

Setting the `cropType` query string will set a value in session storage, which is later read to freeze the crop type available. This is useful in embedded Grid when the ratio matters, for example a video thumbnail should be a 16:9 ratio.

Allow session storage to be cleared if `cropType === 'all'`. That is, we're happy to crop to any ratio.

add `isInferred` to SyndicationRights model

add `isInferred` to SyndicationRights model

The motivation behind this is to copy the publish date across to inferred images as we only want to send images to syndication partners if they've been published.

Previously, we were using the absence of `published` as an indicator for inferred rights and to know which images to propagate rights to. With the above rule, we would not be sending all the images we should be!

update inferred rights when updating an image's photoshoot

When an image moves between photoshoots, we need to be sure any inferred syndication rights are up-to-date in the old and new photoshoot.

Image has inferred rights:
- if we're removing it from a photoshoot, remove its inferred rights
- if we're moving it into a photoshoot, recalculate its inferred rights:
  - if the photoshoot has images with explicit rights, use the latest
  - else remove the inferred rights

Image has explicit rights:
- if the image was in a photoshoot, refresh the inferred rights for images in that photoshoot:
  - use the latest explicit rights in the photoshoot that's not this image. If none, clear inferred rights across the photoshoot
- if we're moving into a photoshoot and this image's rights is the latest, copy the rights across the photoshoot
- if we're moving into a photoshoot and this image's rights is not the latest, do nothing (TODO record these as a metric to know how often it happens)

remove syndicated usages from the syndication tier

When we send an image for syndication, we record a syndication usage.

In order to not send the same image again and again, remove images with a syndication usage from the syndication tier.

This is a slightly hacky solution as it doesn't scale beyond one syndication partner. For example, if partner A takes an image, partner B will no longer see it. However, we only have 1 partner at the moment.

A scalable solution would be to record a syndication key against an usage and filter accordingly. We could do this once we have to support multiple syndication partners.

Merge pull request #2169 from guardian/aa-syndication-tier

introduce a syndication tier and replace external with readonly
update tests

introduce a syndication tier and replace external with readonly

With the new syndication rights model provided by RCS, we can simplfy the api tier policy. The tiers are now:
- Internal - full api access, typically a Grid service such as S3 Watcher. Can perform any action on any image and endpoint.
- Readonly - an Editorial Tool that needs Grid API access, such as Fronts. Can only perform GET actions.
- Syndication - a syndication partner. Can only GET images that are syndicatable, as informed by the RCS feed

Fix optional field deserialisation bug for userMetadata

This seems to have been caused by a change in behaviour of the `.asOpt` method in Play. Before the upgrade to 2.6 if the field was missing it deserialised to a fully empty `Edits` object, presumably because everything has a default parameter including `ImageMetadata`. After the upgrade it was correctly returning `None`. Unfortunately the frontend now relies on that field being present (and empty if no userMetadata is present in Elasticsearch).

Use the Apache Commons HttpClient lib in Cropper (#1926)

... to talk to media api.

There is a bug in Play WS that prevents requests made to secure
endpoints using SNI from handshaking. Cropper is now behind an SNI
secured endpoint and is conseqnetly suffering from this bug:

https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/play-framework/T7ZhclgAAMU

This PR moves the request functionality in Cropper to use Apache Commons
HttpClient library which supports SNI as of version 4.3.2, see:

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HTTPCLIENT-1119

This PR is required to move to using Cloudfront for all user facing REST
APIs (in order that out-of-region request times are sped up, and network
reliability increased).

Make /management/manifest return JSON

In order to allow the UI client to understand when the API has changed
this makes the manifest endpoint (more) machine readable.

Ultimately the intention is allow the kahuna client to refresh itself if
it's out of sync with the server version.

`GET /management/manifest`

```json
{
  "data": {
    "Build": "DEV",
    "Built-On": "derpbox",
    "Built-By": "rkenny",
    "Revision": "DEV",
    "Branch": "DEV",
    "Date": "Tue Mar 29 10:30:43 BST 2016"
  }
}
```

Allow negated text searches

The ability to do these was removed with the removal of the "any" chip.

Merge pull request #1731 from guardian/aa-font

update fonts and remove unused fonts
update fonts and remove unused fonts

upgrade to Docker 1.10 and Compose 1.6

Benefits:
 - With the new `context` directive, the docker-compose.yml file is moved to the more standard project root
 - Docker 1.10 uses an internal DNS, which looks more reliable than injected hosts file; migrate to `depends_on` directive to signify dependancy order
 - No need for a dedicated shared volume container - use the new top level `volumes` directive, mounting `ivy` and `sbt` on the base `sbt` container
 - Initial testing suggests networking in Docker 1.10 is a lot more reliable (likely because of the new internal DNS)

Drawbacks:
 - docker-osx-dev doesn't handle the new top level `volumes` directive. For example, it warns of No such file or directory as it tries to sync grid/configs-vol grid/ivy-vol grid/sbt-vol.

Use CROSS_FIELDS type in multi_match query.

The default is `BEST_FIELDS` which is most useful when searching for multiple words best found in the same field.

`CROSS_FIELDS` treats fields with the same analyzer as though they were one big field. Looks for each word in any field.

Fixing issue where a missing field is not treated correctly.

In a selection of images, its not guaranteed that all images have the same metadata fields, e.g. some may not have a title. `allFields` is the set of all unique metadata fields in the selection of images. Now, we loop over `allFields` to find the corresponding value or undefined for an image.

For example, if there are two images selected and one has a title and the other doesn't, the `metadata` object now looks like `{"title": Set {"title 1", undefined}` rather then `{"title: Set {"title 1"}`. As we switch on the size of `metadata`, we now correctly display "Multiple Titles" rather than "title 1".
